If you would like to print a copy of your summary screen, you may do so by using an "Alt PrtSc" function. Press "Alt PrtSc" and then "Edit/Paste" the information into a blank document of your word processing program. You may then use the normal print function within that program.
Your beginning balance is the amount you now hold in your account.

You may enter an amount or a percent of your salary. You may override your salary by inputting a different amount. If your pay is calculated on an hourly basis, you will see your pay rate as an hourly amount. If you are paid based on a salary, your annual salary will be displayed.
You also have the capability to enter a projected salary increase. Input an hourly amount if your screen shows an hourly pay rate. Enter an annual amount if you see an annual salary.
Enter the amount or percent your company will contribute toward your investment. If you enter a percent, it is calculated as a percent of your contribution, not a percent of your salary.
Select how frequently you believe interest will be computed on your investment (on the sum of your principle and accrued interest.)
Enter the number of years your contributions will be invested.
Enter the average annual rate of return you expect from your investment.
Input the percent of inflation that represents the change in today's cost of living over the previous year's cost of living. For more information regarding inflation consult The Consumer Price Index.

This table includes information regarding time off plans, plan balances and the balance as-of dates.

This table includes general information related to your job. For example, some of the fields listed are employee number, department, supervisor and hire date. The last entry on the table holds your pay rate.
This table includes both confidential and non-confidential information. Fields such as birth date, social number, nickname and gender are included.

This table lists checks in descending order for a period of one year, beginning with today's date. The list includes payment date, gross and net wages. Select a payment date and corresponding summary and detail information display in different windows.
This table includes wage and deduction detail for the selected check.

The summary window includes a printable pay stub hyperlink and a table with summary data. Summary information includes things like payment and period end dates, gross and net wages as well as direct deposit information, if relevant.

Default data has been posted to this personnel action for the position you have selected.
You must have a 9.0 product line to use Performance Management.
Use the Review panel to see what reviews are available for an employee.
To edit a review, click on the review type. An Edit panel will appear to the right of the form.
To change the order of the display, click on the Schedule Date or Complete Date headings. Click again to change the display to ascending or descending.
Use the Edit panel to edit or view detailed review information. Consider the following fields:
The TalentView competency model that was used for the performance appraisal.

The employee's percentile ranking value from TalentView. Performance rankings within a group of employees are calculated from the individual scores of each employee in the group, using the same competency model.
Groups are determined when you set up Performance Management and TalentView.
The employee's score from TalentView. Performance scores are an average of the evaluations scores given by all respondents that evaluated that particular employee.
The employee's goal score from GoalView. The goal score is based on an average of individual objective goal scores.
An individual's goal score for an objective is calculated by multiplying the percent complete by a weighting value (as determined by the priority). Priorities are given the following weights:

You can enter the overall score directly in the field, or you can calculate it by clicking the Update button. The overall score is determined by multiplying the performance score by the performance weighting and multiplying the goal score by the goal weighting and then totaling the two values together.
The Performance and Goal Weighting field values may be updated for the employee review by processing TalentView Data Update (HS701) or by entering these values directly on Review (PA26.1).
Note about Performance and Goal Weighting:

You can use Review (PA26.1) or the TalentView Data Update (HS701) CSV file to add performance and goal weights to a performance review to be used in the overall performance scoring calculation. If you entered weights on PA26.1 or you used them when you imported TalentView information with the CSV file and there are performance and goal scores present, you will see these weights on the Edit Review panel.

The weight values represent a percent. To calculate the overall score, the performance score is multiplied by the Performance Weighting value, rounded to the nearest whole number, and then divided by 100. The same calculation is performed using the goal information to determine the goal score. These calculated values are added together to determine the overall score.
Are you sure you want to delete this review?

To edit an objective, click on the objective. An Edit panel will appear to the right of the form.
To change the order of the display, click on the Due Date, Priority, or % Complete headings. Click again to change the display to ascending or descending.
To score current objectives, place a check in the Goal Score column next to the objective you want included in the score.
Use the Edit Objective panel to edit or view detailed objective information. Consider the following fields:
The objective's priority. When you score the goals, priorities are given the following weights:
The percentage that indicates the level of completeness. This is multiplied by the priority to calculate the Goal Score.
When the employee enters 100 in the Percent Compete field of the Employee Self-Service GoalView task, the Complete status automatically updates to Employee Complete.
When the manager selects Manager Complete in this field, the objective will move to the Completed view of the Employee and Manager Self Service GoalView tasks
